instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>

USB-C circuit was fcked. corrosion on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and the same area of the back as well. I had to replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>,<CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR> and fix a couple of missing traces.

before rework iget no voltages anywhere at all. after <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> area rework, I get 20v on PP20V but sometime I get 5.2v then give it a minute or so then the voltage rise to 20v.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 13v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_LDO3V</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SMC</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4
<SIGNAL>PP3V1_RTC</SIGNAL> = 3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_UPC_XA</SIGNAL> 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 0V



Do i have a dead SMC or <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?


i have two <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donor boards. what stencil pitch size i use on this new SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message: So <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> is present and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not. I would say something around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> is a problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Is it possible the <CHIP>U7659</CHIP> replacement i took from a donor is bad?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Possible or bad soldering. Replace it again including both FETs on the 3V3 side and check resistors/traces around there too, especially the VIN pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
While replacing <CHIP>U7659</CHIP> with a new one, then I notice “<RESISTOR>R7686</RESISTOR>” resistor was missing. I must have forgotten to put this resistor back on. Logic board can power up and boot now. But battery status says “replace now” and won’t charge. Is it possible I have a bad communication battery circuit, don't really want to replace the battery, it looks new.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/MzsAQNw.jpg[/img]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Um no replace now means replace now lol. You could install the board in a different housing if you have one and see if that goes away to confirm it's the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 13" 2016 - Liquid Damaged - Dead - No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>
threads.message: nope, they are super expensive. I did replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> from a new spool, could this have caused? I've heard original chip contain firmware.
